title: Senior Network and Security Engineer (Contract)
description: [     American Seafoods      Senior Network & Security Engineer (Contract January - May 2020 in Seattle)    Job Description Date Written: 6/2018  Status:   Exempt   Supervision Received:   IT Operations Manager   Supervises:   None   Job Role & Contribution   From rich source waters, we sustainably harvest and responsibly manage a quality catch—and with gratitude—to feed (literally) billions of people around the world. We are proud to provide better food, sourced from a better place. Our pioneering spirit drives us to invent new ways of moving our business and industry forward. Together, we bridge between the rising consumer demand for delicious, healthy food and the distant, pristine waters where we harvest. We are deadly serious about health and safety and are always looking for ways to be better and do better. This job helps achieve these goals by maintaining availability to reliable network systems via adherence to industry standard information security and network engineering practices. These network and security systems enable consistent access to vital systems required for governmental reporting, manufacturing process, and business continuity.   Position Summary    *NOTE: This is not a remote position, must be based in Seattle . This role is responsible for all aspects of Network and Security lifecycle in adherence to established policy. This position designs, builds and supports data communication networks, operational technology (OT) networks, monitoring, and data security including local area networks (LANs), wide area networks (WANs), network security, and endpoint security for American Seafoods Group. Network connectivity and secure systems are integral to maintaining 24x7 operations of the organization e.g., government reporting, manufacturing, critical vessel systems, and business continuity. While serving as the networking and information security subject matter expert, this position will identify, manage, and coordinate appropriate service providers and maintain vendor relationships.   Duties and Responsibilities    Build network models for analysis and planning  Design, test, and implement complex data networks  Implement network enhancements based on trends analysis e.g. continuous improvement of low bandwidth high cost VSAT network  Troubleshoot network through root cause analysis to isolate and diagnose complex network problems that traverse terrestrial and/or VSAT networks  Identify and resolve highly complex or specialized issues that may require departures from traditional approaches and the establishment of new techniques and processes. Work on complex issues where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors. Exercise judgment in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results. Network with key contacts outside own area of expertise  Plan, implement, and maintain operational technology (OT) networks and security  Identify security gaps, develop security system enhancements, and recommend changes to policy  Continuously update job knowledge through awareness of emerging security and network practices and standards  Maintain and update network and security systems documentation  Conduct Disaster Recovery and Business Continuity planning, implementation, and testing  Coordinate and manage managed security provider operations and projects  Act as the primary point of contact for vendors and service providers related to network and security. Monitor and manage their activities as necessary to meet organizational goals  Manage projects related to areas of responsibility  Budget in area of responsibility    Job Interdependencies   In order to be successful, the employee in this job will need to depend on, work closely with and partner with a number of others in the office and the vessels. These interdependencies include:   Operations and vessel crew to maintain Ethernet and vSAT connectivity and performance of OT networks, troubleshoot all Ethernet connected devices located on OT network  IT department to design, implement, and troubleshoot complex critical systems spanning multiple areas of expertise  Vendors, administrators, and engineers in area of expertise  All Corporate and Vessel employees to address any network and security related concerns    Competencies/Skills Required    Competent in/with the following areas and tools:  VMware (ESXi, VSphere, and Cross vCenter NSX)  Routing and Switching (ISR4000, Nexus 9000, and Cisco Catalyst)  eBGP, iBGP and OSPF  vPC, STP, VLAN, VXLAN, VTEP, iSCSI, GRE, IPSEC, VPN, DSCP, DNS, DHCP, multicast, IPSLA, VRF, netflow, HSRP, VRRP, GLBP, SNMP, SSL, AAA, Radius, 802.1x  Network Quality of Service  Network based IPS and IDS systems  Network Analysis tools (Wireshark)  Next Generation Firewalls (Cisco Firepower and Fortigate)  Experience in evaluating and assessing security threats across a variety of environments  Vulnerability Scanning (Qualys)  Micro-segmentation  Endpoint Security, detection, and response  Wireless (Cisco and Meraki)  Network and Systems Monitoring (Solarwinds, SCOM, VMware Network insight, VMware log insight)    Strong understanding of Modern IT infrastructures  Strong analytical and problem solving skills  Proven experience supporting mission-critical IT systems  Strong decision making skills  Effective verbal, presentation and listening communications skills  Effective written communication and documentation skills  Effective time management skills  Must be able to work well independently with little or no supervision    Education/Experience Required   4-year degree preferably in MIS or Computer Science  7+ Years of progressive experience in Network and Security Engineering  Experience VSAT networks  Professional Certifications: CISSP, CCNP Routing and Switching, and CCNP-Security or Equivalent   Work Schedule   Anticipated hours are:  Monday – Friday 8:00 am - 5:00 pm  24 x 7 x 365 availability in area of expertise  Participate in 4-week on call rotation  Job Type: Contract  Salary: $1.00 to $2.00 /year  Full Time Opportunity:   No   Work Location:   One location   This Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:   Adaptable/flexible -- enjoys doing work that requires frequent shifts in direction  Detail-oriented -- would rather focus on the details of work than the bigger picture  Innovative -- prefers working in unconventional ways or on tasks that require creativity   This Company Describes Its Culture as:   Aggressive -- competitive and growth-oriented  Outcome-oriented -- results-focused with strong performance culture  Stable -- traditional, stable, strong processes   Schedule::   Monday to Friday    ]

title: IT Security Engineer
description: [    Are you passionate about IT Security? Are you interested in being part of a fast-paced, international and dynamic company? Then maybe this position as IT Security Engineer within ASSA ABLOY Entrance Systems might be for you!   As an IT Security Engineer in ASSA ABLOY Entrance Systems you will be part of our Security Incident Response Team (SIRT) with technical and proactive security operation work. You will be working in a global organization/department that is dynamic and fast paced, with many possibilities to make a difference and add value to the business. The team members are open and result oriented, always looking out for each other as well as working to reach the goals for the company. Everyone is important to building the success. Security is a high prioritized area for us and we continuously build on this important focus area.   What you will be doing  Your primary mission as part of the Divisional SIRT will be to act on and handle vulnerabilities and intrusions of varied severities, reaching from immediate threats to more preventative actions such as implement & develop our sensor tools in order to monitor the IT infrastructure and thereby fortifying our defenses.  The team focus on the Divisional IT infrastructure, but also work in projects together with similar teams across the divisions, ensuring the continuous strengthening of the IT infrastructure for the whole group.  This position reports to our Divisional IT Infrastructure Manager.   What we are looking for   We think that you have previous experience from working in global enterprise IT departments, and you are used to working on a global level finding the challenges this can have as intriguing. You have documented experience in the IT Security field, and you are passionate about your profession. Experience with Tenable, Windows Server Infrastructure, Microsoft Application Management and Enterprise Networking is meriting. As well as certifications such as CISSP and CEH. Since English is our corporate language we expect you to have a high professional knowledge and be able to speak, read and write freely when interacting with your international colleagues.    Let’s open the doors to the future – together!     Working for ASSA ABLOY means that you will be part of a dynamic environment, developing innovative solutions to improve our customers' lives. As the global leader in door opening solutions we are using the latest technologies to open doors to events, hospitals, education, homes, hotels, airports and businesses. Joining ASSA ABLOY means being part of a fast-moving company with many opportunities.   Job Type: Full-time  Salary: $75,000.00 to $85,000.00 /year  Additional Compensation:   Bonuses   Work Location:   One location   Benefits:   Health insurance  Dental insurance  Vision insurance  Retirement plan  Paid time off    ]

title: Senior Cyber Security Engineer
description: [    Position Overview   Be among the first to innovate information exchange security methodologies in the aviation domain! The candidate will use his/her expertise in advanced information security concepts to work with a global community of information security experts within the International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) to develop new strategies to ensure data integrity in an asynchronous, distributed global network of aviation data. Candidate will work closely with engineers and software developers to prototype such capabilities for message exchanges in an Enterprise Messaging Service (EMS) environment with JMS and AMQP protocols and plan simulations to demonstrate the capabilities.   NOTE:   This is NOT a position to ensure compliance of information technology systems with existing info assurance policies & procedures; this is a position to innovate new cybersecurity mechanisms.   Essential Functions    Analyze and provide expertise, advice, recommendations on new, innovative information security solutions in an environment with rapidly advancing technologies and concepts.  Collaborate and contribute to global community of security experts and ICAO to build international consensus on security approaches and ensure interoperability.  Understand various Enterprise Messaging Service (EMS) protocols such as JMS and AMQP and devise innovative methods to ensure end-to-end security (Confidentiality, Integrity, Availability) between producers and consumers.  Develop technical papers such as architecture & design documents, plans, conference papers, and working papers for ICAO.  Participate on panels and provide presentations, speeches on innovative cybersecurity topics in aviation.  Initiate activities and lead working groups, technical information meetings, etc.    Qualifications    BS or higher in an engineering or equivalent technical field from a US accredited institution.  15+ years professional engineering experience (advanced degrees may be substituted).  Advanced knowledge and expertise in cybersecurity concepts, technologies, and methodologies such as end-to-end security and developing information security solutions, especially relating to encryption, key management, hashes, and cyphers.  Be innovative and devise new concepts for cybersecurity.  Excellent written & oral communication and presentation skills, and interpersonal skills.  Familiarity with EMS(s) and their configurations.    Additional Desired Skills    Advanced graduate degrees in information security or security certification such as CISSP.  Knowledgeable in security standards and governance such as NIST.  Knowledgeable in FAA security processes and related infrastructure.    Position Type: Full Time    Keywords:   Information Security, Security Engineering, Data Integrity, Cybersecurity, Encryption, Message Exchange, Key Management, Aviation, System Engineering, FAA, NextGen  Job Type: Full-time  Experience:   Cyber Security: 1 year (Preferred)  FAA: 1 year (Preferred)   Education:   Bachelor's (Preferred)   Location:   Washington, DC (Preferred)    ]

title: Sr Technical Security Engineer
description: [   The Senior Technical Security Engineer will work closely with NCB's Information Security team to design, deploy, support and administer NCB's technical controls ensuring NCB's risk appetite is acceptable throughout the organization.  The Senior Technical Security Engineer will support the development and definition of security requirements, security risk assessments, system analysis, system designs, security test and evaluations, certification and accreditation, system hardening, vulnerability management, incident response management, corrective action management, disaster recovery and business continuity planning.  As an integral member of NCB's IT team, the IT Security Technical Engineer will work with Information Security team on all activities necessary to ensure the safety of NCB's information system assets while protecting the systems from unauthorized access internal and external across the organization.  1. Lead the development, implementation and administration of NCB's 32 security controls. 40% 2. Provide tier 3 and 4 security technical support.35% 3. Assist the Chief Information Security Officer and Chief Information Officer.15% 4. Assist with NCB audits and penetration test. 10%  Minimum Qualifications:   6+ years of security experience at least 5 years of direct hands on experience.  Currently holding or the ability to obtain CISSP, CCNA w/Security within 6 months    Knowledgeable with firewall devices (Cisco, PaloAlto and Panarama software)  Knowledgeable with Network access software (ForeScout CounterAct)  Knowledgeable with various security applications (AppRiver, GFI, Varonis, RSA, Active Directory, Privileged Access management)  Knowledgeable with MSSP/SIEM integration (internal and external)  Knowledgeable with McAfee security suite (ePolicy, Encryption, DLP, web and mail filtering, etc.)  Patching and vulnerability management (KACE, Nessus/tenable security center)    Ability to communicate technical solutions to project management, development team, operations team, information security team and IT solutions team.    Well-rounded knowledge of networking (ex. Windows, LAN/WAN, routing, firewalls, cloud services.  Ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment.   EOE/AA  Job Type: Full-time  Experience:   relevant: 5 years (Preferred)    ]

title: Senior Security Engineer
description: [   Senior Security Engineer  Job Description:  We are looking for a skilled Security Engineer to analyze product designs and implementations from a security perspective, as well as to identify and resolve security issues in all company procedures to maintain internal security and our compliance with industry security regulations. You will be responsible for incorporating the appropriate security analysis, defense and countermeasures at each phase of the software development lifecycle, to produce robust and reliable products.  Responsibilities:   Implement, test and operate advanced software security techniques in compliance with technical reference architecture  Perform on-going security testing and code review to improve software security  Troubleshoot and debug issues that arise  Provide engineering designs for new software solutions to help mitigate security vulnerabilities  Contribute to all levels of the architecture  Collaborate on those and tasks with outsourced technology team members  Maintain security of employee hardware, both laptops and cell phones.  Maintain technical documentation  Audit and maintain all company processes to be compliant with industry security regulations, i.e HIPAA, GDPR, etc.,  Consult team members on secure coding practices  Develop a familiarity with new tools and best practices   Requirements:   Proven work experience as a Security engineer  Detailed technical knowledge of techniques, standards and state-of-the art capabilities for authentication and authorization, applied cryptography, security vulnerabilities and remediation  Software development experience in one of the following core languages: PHP, Java, and Javascript  Adequate knowledge of web related technologies (Web applications, Web Services and Service Oriented Architectures), Mobile technologies (iOS and Android) and of network/web related protocols  Knowledge of Privacy, Security, and Breach Notification Rules, other industry Security regulations, i.e HIPAA, GDPR, etc., and industry best practices and standards  Interest in all aspects of security research and development  BS degree in Computer Science or related field  7+ years of experience required   Job Type: Full-time  Experience:   relevant: 7 years (Preferred)   Additional Compensation:   Bonuses   Work Location:   One location   Benefits:   Health insurance  Dental insurance  Vision insurance  Retirement plan  Paid time off   This Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:   Dependable -- more reliable than spontaneous  Detail-oriented -- would rather focus on the details of work than the bigger picture  Autonomous/Independent -- enjoys working with little direction  High stress tolerance -- thrives in a high-pressure environment   Schedule:   Monday to Friday  No weekends    ]

title: Information Security Engineer
description: [   VersaTrust is a leading Managed IT and Cybersecurity services provider founded in 1997 and located in Fort Worth. We provide IT and cybersecurity management, support and solutions to small and medium sized businesses in Fort Worth and surrounding areas.  We are seeking an Information Security Engineer to join our team. The Information Security Engineer is experienced in many of the most common cybersecurity controls, processes, compliance requirements, risk assessment and audit methodologies, incident management and security best practices. In addition to strong aptitude, backed by at least five years of security experience, this role requires good communication and customer facing skills. This is a lead role, assisting security analysts with task assignment, configuration guidance, incident escalation as well as providing guidance directly to clients with regard to compliance and security strategy.  Our Core Values are Trust, which leads to Performance, which leads to Opportunity. We live by these daily as a team and in service to our clients, and are looking for a candidate who lives by these values as well. We have a great team and great clients and are looking forward to adding a new member to the team.  Position Responsibilities:   Install and configure SIEM, IDS/IPS, HIDS/NIDS, vulnerability scanning, anti-malware software, firewall and other tools across our client base to provide effective defense to reduce risk  Provide policy, process and procedural guidance for our internal SOC and client facing security requirements  Provide escalation and guidance to security analysts for incident management  Assess effectiveness of internal and client facing security controls  Conduct security policy and regulatory compliance reviews and communicate residual risk  Provide regulatory compliance guidance for NIST 800-171, HIPAA, PCI and others   Qualifications/Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:   Bachelor's degree in a related field or equivalent experience, and possess at least one of the following certifications:  CISSP or equivalent  CEH or equivalent   Please send your cover letter and resume for immediate consideration.  Job Type: Full-time  Benefits:   Health insurance  Retirement plan  Paid time off  Professional development assistance    ]

title: Systems Security Engineer (ISSE)
description: [   We are seeking a Systems Security Engineer with a Bachelor's degree in Systems Security, Network Engineering, Information Technology, or a related Engineering field and at least 3 years of related experience. In this challenging, fast-paced environment, you'll have the opportunity to apply your knowledge and experience to design and create the most groundbreaking aerospace and defense technologies - those that exist today and those that will shape tomorrow.    What to look forward to:    As a Systems Security Engineer, you will be using your skills and expertise to design, test, and implement our secure operating systems, networks, security monitoring, and tuning. You'll be responsible for the management of our IT security systems and applications, incident response, digital forensics, loss prevention, and eDiscovery actions, conducting risk and vulnerability assessments, and developing and implementing security controls. You'll research, evaluate, and recommend new security tools, techniques, and technologies in alignment with our IT security strategy and introduce them to the enterprise.    At SNC’s Integrated Mission Systems (IMS) team we are an agile, high-caliber contractor that engineers, builds, integrates, modifies and supports turnkey air- and ground-based Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (ISR) products and services. Our years of experience supporting the Department of Defense, Department of Homeland Security, commercial and international customers have established us as the systems integrator of choice. We take great pride in the customer mission we support. Learn more about IMS     Must-haves:    Bachelor's degree in Systems Security, Network Engineering, Information Technology, or related Engineering discipline and at least 3 years of relevant experience   Must meet DoD 8570 IASAE Level II (CAP, CASP+ CE, CISM, CISSP (or Associate), GSLC)      Preferred:    ISSEP MCSE, Linux Certification   The ability to obtain and maintain a Security Clearance may be required Learn more about the background check process for Security Clearances      At Sierra Nevada Corporation (SNC) we deliver customer-focused technology and best-of-breed integrations in the aerospace and defense sectors. SNC has been honored as one of the most innovative U.S. companies in space, a Tier One Superior Supplier for the U.S. Air Force, and as one of America’s fastest-growing companies. Learn more about SNC      IMPORTANT NOTICE:    This position requires an active Top Secret   U.S. Security Clearance. U.S. Citizenship status is required as this position needs an active U.S. Security Clearance for employment. Non-US citizens may not be eligible to obtain a security clearance. The Department of Defense Consolidated Adjudications Facility (DoD CAF), a federal government agency, handles the adjudicative aspects of the security clearance eligibility process for industry applicants. Adjudicative factors which affect the outcome of the eligibility determination include, but are not limited to, allegiance to the US, foreign influence, foreign preference, criminal conduct, security violations and illegal drug use.      Sierra Nevada Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer    – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran, or any other protected status   pursuant to applicable local, state or federal law, ordinance or regulation.      ]

title: Colocation Planning Network Engineer

title: Senior Network Engineer
description: [      Compensation : $71,385.60 annually     Maintain stable operations of company network environment and provide optimal network performance across all Compass Health locations. This includes research, planning, developing, and configuration of new and existing projects/technologies to introduce into company network infrastructure. Provide continual maintenance of new and existing network hardware/software. Follow best practices methods for configuration and security of network hardware/software. Communicate to senior management of any issues that may arise as well as any projects requiring network downtime. Provide monitoring and reporting for all aspect of company network infrastructure and performance. Provide network support to all locations throughout the Compass Health network. Supervise and provide training for junior network employees. Duties include:   1) Manage Compass Health network infrastructure, including managed services routers, switches, firewalls, security appliances, and wireless hardware/software  2) Perform network design and capacity planning  3) Conduct research on network products, services, protocols and standards in support of network procurement and development efforts  4) Interact and negotiate with vendors, outsourcers and contractors to secure network products and services  5) Develop, implement and maintain policies, procedures and associated training plans for network resource administration, appropriate use, and disaster recovery  6) Practice network asset management, including maintenance of network component inventory and related documentation and technical specifications information  7) Administer and maintain end user accounts, permissions, and access rights  8) Perform system backups and recovery  9) Monitor and test network performance and provide network performance statistics and reports  10) Recommend, schedule and perform network improvements, upgrades and repairs  11) Manage and/or provide guidance to junior members of the team           Job Requirements    1) College diplomas or university degree in the field of computer science and/or three (5) years equivalent work experience  2) Current certification with Cisco networking (CCNA or CCNP) or equivalent  3) Expert knowledge of various routing/switching protocols  4) High level understanding of configuration and deployment of Cisco/Meraki, HP, Aruba, and Fortinet devices and software  5) Expert knowledge of title: Lead Network Engineer
description: [    About ThousandEyes   The name ThousandEyes was born from two big ideas: the power to see things not ordinarily possible and the ability to collect insights from a multitude of vantage points. As organizations rely more on cloud services and the Internet, the network has become a "black box" outside of their control. ThousandEyes gives organizations visibility and insight into the now borderless network. It arms them with an accurate understanding of how the network impacts their applications, users and customers. ThousandEyes is used by some of the world's largest and fastest growing brands, including 4 of the top 5 SaaS companies, 4 of the top 6 US banks and 3 of the Fortune 5. ThousandEyes is backed by Sequoia Capital, Google Ventures, Tenaya Capital and Sutter Hill Ventures, with headquarters in San Francisco, CA.  Engineering at ThousandEyes   At ThousandEyes, we use cutting-edge technologies and innovative techniques to study and visualize networks on a global scale. ThousandEyes engineers are focused on continuous improvement — of our product, our codebase, our knowledge, and our skills. We believe in innovation, simplicity, and elegance. We work in small, cross-functional teams where everyone has a voice.  About the role   ThousandEyes network reliability engineers are responsible for building and operating our production network, ensuring network scalability and reliability as well as developing and deploying tools to help manage and monitor our network. We’re looking for talented and highly proficient network reliability engineers with a software and/or network background.   Apply for this role if you:     Are a fast learner and comfortable working with new technologies  Are exceptional with network fundamentals and protocols such as TCP/IP, DNS, BGP, OSPF, and HTTP  Have experience with open-source network automation frameworks and building software to manage and monitor the network (common languages are Python and Go)  Are familiar with various network hardware and operating systems  Have network security experience including network and application firewalls, IDS, IPS, and DDoS  Are comfortable working with Linux systems, containers and Kubernetes    Our infrastructure technology stack:     Cumulus Networks  Cisco  F5 Networks  Juniper  Palo Alto Networks  Prometheus  GoBGP  Kubernetes  Puppet  Ansible  Terraform   Job Type: Full-time  Experience:   Scripting/Automation: 1 year (Required)  Network Implementation: 5 years (Required)  Network Operations: 5 years (Required)  Network Design: 5 years (Required)   Work authorization:   United States (Required)   Work Location:   One location   Benefits:   Health insurance  Dental insurance  Vision insurance  Retirement plan  Paid time off  Parental leave    ]

title: Network Engineer
description: [     Network Engineer    Y-Tech is looking for a Network Engineer who will be responsible for maintaining and administering our NARA's computer networks. Your primary duties will include maintenance of computer networks, hardware, software, and other related systems, performing disaster recovery operations, protecting data, software, and hardware from attacks, and replacing faulty network hardware components when necessary. You will also be working closely with the users of our network in order to identify potential issues and fix existing problems.   To be a successful candidate, you will need to have a strong understanding of network infrastructure and network hardware. You will also need to be able to implement, administer, and troubleshoot network devices including WAPs, firewalls, routers, switches, and controllers. A deep knowledge of application transport and network infrastructure protocols is highly desired.    Network Engineer Responsibilities:     Maintaining and administering computer networks and related computing environments including systems software, applications software, hardware, and configurations.   Performing disaster recovery operations and data backups when required.   Protecting data, software, and hardware by coordinating, planning and implementing network security measures.   Troubleshooting, diagnosing and resolving hardware, software, and other network and system problems.   Replacing faulty network hardware components when required.   Maintaining, configuring, and monitoring virus protection software and email applications.   Monitoring network performance to determine if adjustments need to be made.   Conferring with network users about solving existing system problems.   Operating master consoles to monitor the performance of networks and computer systems.   Coordinating computer network access and use.   Designing, configuring and testing networking software, computer hardware, and operating system software.     Network Engineer Requirements:     Bachelor degree in Information Technology related field of study with a network engineering focus.   Strong understanding of network infrastructure and network hardware.   Ability to think through problems and visualize solutions.   Ability to implement, administer, and troubleshoot network infrastructure devices, including wireless access points, firewall, routers, switches, controllers.   Knowledge of application transport and network infrastructure protocols.   Ability to create accurate network diagrams and documentation for design and planning network communication systems.   Provides specific detailed information for hardware and software selection.   Ability to quickly learn new or unfamiliar technology and products using documentation and internet resources.   Ability to work with all levels of staff within and outside of IT and outside the organization.   A self-starter able to work independently but comfortable working in a team environment.   Good analytical and problem-solving skills.   Dependable and flexible when necessary.   Network security experience.   LAN and WAN experience.       ]

title: Sr. Network Engineer
description: [    Shift: 1st shift Mon to Friday 8 am to 4 pm. Nights and weekends are required at times, including on-call support.    Responsibilities: This position will be responsible for the development, implementation, and maintenance of the network infrastructure for Froedtert Health. This infrastructure primarily includes network switches, routers, firewalls, cabling plant, and wireless solutions. Duties include architecting LAN/WAN solutions, wireless infrastructure, VoIP solutions, and Internet connectivity/availability; configuring and troubleshooting VPNs; making routing changes; configuring server load balancing, blade center switches, and firewall ACLs; and installing and supporting radius/tacacs servers. Typical tasks include support for videoconferencing and wireless supplicant, profile creation, and chipsets. Support may also include installing, configuring, maintaining, and documenting routers and wireless controllers; adding static address translations; installing and maintaining data communications circuits; performing active wireless site surveys; and performing wireless spectrum analysis. The position will work closely with the Network Administration team and Information Technology (IT) leadership to ensure that the network infrastructure delivers at a service level consistent with organizational risk, information access requirements, and business strategies. This position will work closely with other Voice and Data Network team members to promote teamwork, stewardship, and accountability. This person must provide updates regarding the performance and availability of network infrastructure and proactively work to resolve problems. This position works to improve or maintain a high level of system performance through the implementation of sound technologies and the consistent use of generally accepted networking best practices. This role will also provide consulting on enterprise IT initiatives. This role is also responsible for training and mentoring other IT Voice and Data Network team members on best practices and processes. Other duties as assigned  Summary:   A minimum of five years of related IT experience is required.  Experience in a healthcare setting is preferred.  Knowledge of computer/network principles at a level normally acquired through completion of a Bachelor's degree in computer science or other closely related field is required.  CCNP or CCIE certification is preferred.   Other information:   Advanced knowledge of DHCP/DNS, subnetting, multiple routing protocols, switching, firewalls/policy NAT/rules, spanning tree, VTP, power over Ethernet, VoIP, QoS, trunking, VLANs, LAN/WAN technologies, and wireless technologies.  Working knowledge of wireless technologies.  Familiarity with network management and troubleshooting tools (such as ping and traceroute).  Solid capabilities working to plan and meeting deadlines.  Broad knowledge of the IT services, applications, and infrastructure.  Exceptional computer skills utilizing and supporting MS Office and MS Exchange/Outlook. Must have excellent interpersonal skills in communications with all levels of hospital personnel, vendors and IT personnel.  Must be able to train others quickly and thoroughly on key IT concepts.   Job Type: Full-time  Salary: $83,000.00 to $116,000.00 /hour  Experience:   Cisco Router: 5 years (Required)  CCNP: 5 years (Preferred)  LAN/WAN: 5 years (Required)  Cisco Switches: 5 years (Required)   Work Location:   One location   Benefits:   Health insurance  Dental insurance  Vision insurance  Retirement plan  Paid time off   This Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:   Dependable -- more reliable than spontaneous  People-oriented -- enjoys interacting with people and working on group projects  Adaptable/flexible -- enjoys doing work that requires frequent shifts in direction  Detail-oriented -- would rather focus on the details of work than the bigger picture   Schedule::   Monday to Friday    ]

title: Principal Network Engineer
description: [     What you’ll be doing...    At Verizon Connect (VZConnect), we guide a connected world on the go. We’re in it to win it. Today we’re the #1 global provider of fleet management solutions for both enterprise and small/medium businesses. Our consumer products, like Hum, create a more connected ride with vehicle diagnostics, emergency assistance, and Wi-Fi. And to top it off, our partnerships with major car manufacturers help us care for more drivers with our connected technologies.   As a top 20 SaaS leader, we know our talent is the most important component to our success. We hire top talent and empower them to do their best work. As a division of Verizon, we combine the fun and excitement of a start-up environment with the resources, operational excellence, and brand recognition of an established tech giant.   We have an immediate need for a Principal Network Engineer to facilitate the delivery of our award-winning Consumer and Commercial products. In this role, you’ll be responsible for designing and maintaining critical communications between our data centers and connected vehicles. You will also be responsible for 24x7 support of our voice and data networks and rapid incident response. This role offers strong personal and professional growth opportunities to the right person and the ability to have a meaningful impact on in one of the largest SaaS businesses in the world. Other responsibilities associated with this position include:    Designing, supporting, and maintaining network devices in a highly complex environment.   Supporting and maintaining all networking elements of a high availability production environment.   Setting the direction of networking technologies and methodologies for our growing network.   Monitoring, backing up, outage resolution, upgrading, design, and maintenance of networks.     What we’re looking for...    You’ll need to have:    Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.   Six or more years of relevant work experience.   Five or more years of experience with CGNAT technologies.   Five or more years of experience managing and architecting MPLS solutions.   Willingness to travel.    Even better if you have:    A degree.   Seven or more years of experience diagnosing and troubleshooting network issues and outages.   Seven or more years of experience supporting and troubleshooting complex voice traffic.   Seven or more years of experience with network design and architecture.   Seven or more years of network experience with routing and switching.   Seven or more years of network experience with load balancing technologies.   Seven or more years of experience managing firewalls.   Experience with Cisco switching, routing and firewall Hardware.   Experience with Check Point hardware.   Experience with A10 Load balancers and CGNAT.   Experience with routing protocols, specifically BGP, OSPF and EIGRP.   Experience with IPSEC VPN(s) tunnels.   Expertise with TCP/IP packet analysis, using Wireshark or raw packet captures using tcpdump.   Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, with logical problem solving from Layer 1 through Layer 7 of the OSI model.   Experience with network analyzers and network monitoring and alerting tools.   Experience with AWS VPC networking including ELB, EIP, VPN.    VZConnect, #LI-JA1    When you join Verizon...    You’ll have the power to go beyond – doing the work that’s transforming how people, businesses and things connect with each other. Not only do we provide the fastest and most reliable network for our customers, but we were first to 5G - a quantum leap in connectivity. Our connected solutions are making communities stronger and enabling energy efficiency. Here, you’ll have the ability to make an impact and create positive change. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, join our team of the best and brightest. We offer great pay, amazing benefits and opportunity to learn and grow in every role. Together we’ll go far.    Equal Employment Opportunity    We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees' differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. Different makes us better.      ]

title: Network Engineer
description: [   Summary  With locations around the world, Quanex Building Products Corporation is an industry-leading manufacturer of components sold to Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) in the building products industry. Quanex designs and produces energy-efficient fenestration products in addition to kitchen and bath cabinet components.  Quanex is in search of a Network Engineer to be a key member of the Houston based Infrastructure and Network team. This position does require the candidate to work at the Akron office Monday through Friday and travel to Quanex locations on as needed.  The Network Engineer will perform as a key member on project teams regarding the design and implementation of network functions, roles and projects. The successful candidate will have strong technical skills with the ability to communicate plans and proposals to IT leadership effectively and design communications and training resources for technical users as well as end users. As part of the Network Engineer team, this position will be responsible for managing ongoing administration of all aspects of LAN/WAN hardware (switching, routing, security appliances, voice systems), including resource monitoring and optimization. Ability to maintain vendor relationships across multiple WAN/PSTN providers in a disparate network environment, ensuring highest levels of uptime, optimization, interconnectivity, and resiliency.  Maintains standardized configurations and software platforms across network devices; account for the backup and recovery of configurations and software images on network devices. Develop and maintain documentation and standard work regarding systems architecture, configuration, best practice, user guides, etc.  Design, implement and support Cisco voice systems, and have a working knowledge of general vendor-agnostic VoIP technologies (SIP, voice codecs, PSTN interface and signaling, etc)  Working knowledge of wireless technologies including Cisco wireless controllers, access points, frequency/range optimization, and security.  Distributes, implements, and enforces approved policies and procedures for network and security.  Follows best practice troubleshooting guidelines to methodically isolate and solve complex technical challenges.  Provides level 3 support to network problems/questions with assistance of internal/external sources when required  Familiarity with and sensitivity to security best practices, especially as it pertains to secure data communications, physical/logical LAN access, change management, VPN technologies, and unified communication systems; Past experience with SOX compliance preferred  May be required to support multiple locations and provide remote support to centralized solutions   Our Ideal Candidate Will Have:   Bachelor’s degree in Computer science or related field required  CCNA certification required; CCNP preferred  A minimum of 5 years of experience in LAN, WAN, wireless, security technologies  Experience in new infrastructure deployments and network functionality  Supported organizations with multiple sites, preferably including international locations and environments with large/complex network and routing.  Knowledge of and experience with Fortinet, Cisco and HP networking devices/concepts  Strong analytical and interpersonal skills with technical ability to install and troubleshoot complex technical solutions   Job Type: Full-time  Education:   Bachelor's (Required)   Benefits:   Health insurance  Dental insurance  Vision insurance  Paid time off  Professional development assistance  Tuition reimbursement   Schedule::   Monday to Friday    ]

title: Network Engineer
description: [     Description/Job Summary      The Network Engineer's role is to ensure the stability and integrity of in-house voice, data, video, and wireless network services. This is achieved by planning, designing, and developing local area networks (LANs) and wide area networks (WANs) across the organization. In addition, the Network Engineer will participate with the installation, monitoring, maintenance, support, and optimization of all network hardware, software, and communication links. This individual will also analyze and resolve network hardware and software problems in a timely and accurate fashion and provide end user training where required.    Responsibilities/Duties       Strategy & Planning     Collaborate with executive management and department leaders to assess near- and long-term network capacity needs.   Create and maintain documentation as it relates to network configuration, network mapping, processes, and service records.   Develop, implement and maintain policies, procedures, and associated training plans for network administration, usage, and disaster recovery.         Acquisition & Deployment     Design and deploy company LANs, WANs, and wireless networks, including servers, routers, hubs, switches, UPSs, and other hardware.   Conduct research on network products, services, protocols, and standards to remain abreast of developments in the networking industry. Operational Management     Configure networks to ensure their smooth and reliable operation for fulfilling business objectives and processes.   Monitor network performance and troubleshoot problem areas as needed.   Oversee installation, configuration, maintenance, and troubleshooting of end user workstation hardware, software, and peripheral devices.   Ensure network connectivity of all servers, workstations, telephony equipment, fax machines, and other network appliances.   Practice network asset management, including maintenance of network component inventory and related documentation and technical specifications information.   Monitor and test network performance and provide network performance statistics and reports.   Participate in managing all network security solutions.         Technical Knowledge     Familiarity managing and deploying Cisco, Aruba, and Palo Alto devices.   Detailed knowledge of network monitoring protocols and tools. (SNMP, Netflow, Solarwinds)   SDWAN experience preferred.   Cisco Meraki experience preferred.     Required Experience    5+ years experience in a related field     Bachelors degree in Computer Science or Computer Information Systems   CCNA or CCNP certifications   Any other network related certifications.    ]

title: Network Engineer
description: [    We are growing incredibly fast and looking for professionals with MSP experience.    Visit ManagedITServices.com for more information about our company.    Systems and Network Engineers   We are looking for exceptional engineers who know how to work as part of a Team.  Candidates must be versed in basic Server Configuration Methods including Stand alone and Virtualized Environments, Support of WAN and LAN networks, Backups, Email Systems, Disaster Recovery, Business Continuity Planning, Desktop Configuration, Support and Troubleshooting.  The successful candidate will be able to look at simple and complex network environments to troubleshoot any number of problems including, but not limited to, firewall issues, Windows Active Directory complexities, domain namespace blacklisting, printer issues, email delivery problems, backup issues, virtualized system errors, various compliance issues and other problems. In addition, there is a requirement to analyze existing and future client needs and review technical alternatives with these clients to determine the impact on their environment while maintaining a client's security and if applicable compliance needs.  The successful candidate will also demonstrate excellent customer service skills as well as technical excellence in all communications, whether client facing or internally.  TeamLogic IT is the nationwide network that companies entrust with their technology management. We manage IT systems and provide state-of-the-art security and world-class personal service. Excellent Verbal and Writing Skills are a must.  In just over a decade, TeamLogic IT has grown into the nationwide network businesses rely on for Managed IT Services. Our success is driven through one core mission - to leverage technology to to the advantage of our clients. Thousands of businesses across North America are taking advantage of our ability to deliver highly available, secure and flexible IT systems, filling the void in the market for a trusted technology adviser. title: (AWS) Senior Project Manager
description: [    Summary:    * OIT is looking for a project manager/stakeholder relationship manager to drive multiple initiatives for the CBMS and PEAK applications, with a heavy focus on communication, change management, and coordination with stakeholders. * * CBMS is hosted on Amazon Web Services with the user interface fully in Salesforce Lightning Experience. The plan and the burndown rate for the backlog will need to align with management timelines for project completion. * * The initiatives will be impactful to system operation and managing this work requires a proven history of working with many stakeholder groups and implementing change management. Some local travel to counties for meetings may be necessary and will not be reimbursed separately. Experience with AWS is required. * *  Duties:     Facilitate meetings across several teams and serve as the manager over multiple initiatives across multiple vendors. Some local travel to metro counties or other stakeholder locations is required.    Maintain issue logs and document risk mitigation strategies    Utilize a strong understanding of software development methodologies when formulating work plans/sprints    Utilize a personal basic understanding of technical infrastructure in a cloud environment to drive questions/analysis to ensure completeness of sprints    Create status reports, meeting notes and presentations using Microsoft products or Google Docs.    Schedule meetings and conferences calls    Track the status of project tasks by communication with task owners    Maintain concurrent project plans    Author documents to summarize risks, issues, solution alternatives, status or other for delivery to customers and executives    Participate in release planning and command centers, as appropriate based on the initiative    Minimum Requirements:     Experience with hosting in Amazon Web Service    Minimum of 10 years of experience in a system development environment    Minimum of 5 years’ experience developing and managing technical projects, both waterfall and Agile    Minimum of 10 years’ experience delivering projects    Clear Communicator (written and verbal)    Expert knowledge of common business applications; such as, Google Docs, Microsoft Office (Word, Excel), Microsoft Project    Strong analytical and research skills using the internet and other tools    Strong verbal communication skills and ability to facilitate a planning session or meeting    Understanding of data governance, including the security requirements for PII and PHI.    Must be able to work independently and be proactive in reaching for information    Must be comfortable in an environment with rapid change, multiple vendors and multiple concurrent work streams and scrums    Desired Experience:     Understanding of a government environment, Colorado state or county experience preferred    Experience in a cloud environment, Salesforce or AWS environment preferred    Experience working in a government and specifically eligibility and enrollment environment, CBMS experience preferred    Experience in the application of commonly accepted concepts and practices specific to user training and organization change management    Available for occasional non-business hour work   *  Job Type: Contract  Salary: $70.00 to $80.00 /hour  Contract Length:   5 - 6 months   Contract Renewal:   Likely   Additional Compensation:   Other forms   Work Location:   One location   Benefits:   Dental insurance  Vision insurance  Retirement plan    ]

Primary projects will include Serialization Enterprise (IT) Connectivity projects. These projects will require coordination with Regional/Local teams, CMO/Site IT leads and Enterprise Team to meet deadlines set by Global Program Plan. Additional Regional/Local projects to include (but not limited to) onboarding and qualifying new government market systems, new government market requirements/upgrades and leading Serialization Enterprise IT solution upgrades. Long term, under Business as Usual/ Steady State (1-2 years out) project manager will manage projects initiated by Regional/Local teams per governmental requirements, Local/Regional enhancements and projects related to Tier 3 system issues. Essential Functions 1. Develop, lead and manage full life cycle project management activities for projects included within the Global Serialization Program. 2. Identify and mitigate risks associated with assigned projects by developing mitigation plans, following set escalation plans as necessary and proactively monitoring risks throughout the project. 3. Anticipate and proactively address simple or complex bottlenecks or issues. Recommend and implement enhancements to projects by soliciting input from project members and Global Program lead. 4. Manage standard documentation for project work including project plans, project organization, stakeholder outlines, project charters, project execution plans and RAAID Logs (Risk/Action/Assumptions/Issues/Decisions). 5. Develop and maintain project metrics and feedback measurements to ensure professional delivery of projects and proper communication to Global Program Lead and stakeholders.   Qualifications:     BA/BS, preferably in a business, IT or technical field  5+ years Project Management experience required. PMP Certification preferred  Experience in managing large, complex international projects in a multinational environments with multiple stakeholders.  Advanced user in project management tools (e.g. MS Project).  Must be both strategic and task-oriented/ issue resolution focused. Highly developed interpersonal skills are required to effectively communicate with all levels within the organization.  Able to build relationships with third parties (application providers and CMOs).  Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.  Strong presentation and verbal/written communication skills required.  Ability to simultaneously manage and prioritize multiple requests required.    The role may require occasional limited domestic and international travel. title: Software Project Manager
description: [           Software Project Manager            Wärtsilä is leading the transition towards a 100% renewable energy. As an energy system integrator, we – Wärtsilians - understand, design, build and serve optimal power systems for future generations. Our solutions provide the needed flexibility to integrate renewables and secure power system reliability. We support our customers over the lifecycle of their installations with services that enable increased efficiency and guaranteed performance. Did you know that Wärtsilä has 70 GW of installed power plant capacity in 177 countries around the world?      In this era of innovation and fast changing world of energy, we are constantly on the lookout for future-oriented talent to join our team and to work towards enabling sustainable societies with smart technology - together. Want to join the ride?        Energy Storage and Optimization division of Wärtsilä, Headquartered in Herndon, Virginia, is the leading provider of energy control software platform and energy storage systems. Our mission is to advance renewable energy industry using computing technologies.   We are seeking a Software Project Manager in the Washington, DC metropolitan area to join our GEMS Solutions team that builds and delivers effective and efficient software solutions built on top of GEMS platform.    Job Description     Act as Project Manager coordinating multiple customer-facing, commercial projects and internal, product development projects.   Monitoring progress, managing project-related reports and other necessary documentation.   Coordinate among project stakeholders, both internal teams and external partners.   Report and escalate to management as needed.   Work with SCRUM teams and run sprint planning meetings.   Contribute to company vision and participate in projects planning and execution.     Qualifications     Deep expertise in software project management (PMP certification is a plus).   Deep expertise in Jira and Jira administration including workflow, user, portfolio and project management and Jira reports. Expert-level knowledge in other agile development tools including Confluence, Slack and Git.   Expertise in SCRUM and KANBAN Agile methodologies (certification is a plus). Proven-record in organizing agile software development teams.   Software coding experience.   Passionate about process & project management and success of projects.   Ability in managing and tracking multiple projects simultaneously is a must.   Attention to details. Solid communication skills – fluent in English: written and spoken.     Nice to have     Experience in agile software development methodologies, process, and tools.   Experience with industrial automation systems.     We Offer You:     Competitive salary and significant upside in your career path in a fast-growing division.   Dynamic, technology centric working environment within a very focused solutions team.   Opportunity to manage the industry leading software solutions projects with a lasting impact on green energy and smart grids in over 70+ countries.         Wärtsilä is a global leader in smart technologies and complete lifecycle solutions for the marine and energy markets. By emphasising sustainable innovation, total efficiency and data analytics, Wärtsilä maximises the environmental and economic performance of the vessels and power plants of its customers. In 2018, Wärtsilä’s net sales totalled EUR 5.2 billion with approximately 19,000 employees. The company has operations in over 200 locations in more than 80 countries around the world. Wärtsilä is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki.       We look forward to hearing from you. Qualified candidates must apply online https://careers.wartsila.com/search/?q=.   Wärtsilä North America values our employees. We offer a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package. Wärtsilä North America is an EOE/AA employer.        ]

title: Project Manager
description: [     Project Manager – Commercial Flooring Division     Who is Place Services?     Building Our Company by Building Our People    Place Services, Inc. is a nationwide Commercial General Contractor and Subcontractor company specializing in remodeling and new construction of retail Big Box stores. PSI was founded by Troy Place in 2006 and has grown into a $90+ million dollars/year company. We have worked for a wide range of retail giants including Walmart, Publix, JC Penny’s, Best Buy, Hyatt Hotels, CVS, Racetrac, QuikTrip, Kroger, and Macy’s.    Why are we hiring?    Due to an increase in awarded projects, Place Services, Inc. is looking to hire a Project Manager to oversee the management of  multiple small special projects . These are fast-moving projects that are scattered across the nation. This is a great position for a junior project manager that is ready to take the next step in his/her career.    Project Manager Job Description:    Commercial flooring project managers plan, coordinate, and supervise the installation of projects from start to finish. This job involves tasks such as monitoring the installation process to ensure the projects are completed to schedule, negotiating contracts, and maintaining budgets. Commercial flooring project managers work full-time but may need to work additional hours to respond to delays, emergencies, or suppliers.    Project Manager Responsibilities:    Commercial flooring project managers may take on a variety of duties, depending on the project and the organization, these duties typically involve:    Collaborate with Teams to Outline the Project    Commercial flooring project managers work with architects, engineers, and clients to determine the specifications of a project. They plan the installation operations and schedule each phase of the process to make sure the project is completed to the set deadline.    Negotiate Contracts    A key part of this job is negotiating with external vendors. These project managers amend the contract where they can to reach a profitable agreement that all parties are satisfied with and one that works within the set budget.    Determine Necessary Resources    These project managers determine the resources required for each aspect of the project, such as equipment needed, materials, and labor, assessing each of these for budget limitations. They make sure that the equipment, sub-contractors, and materials are scheduled in accordance with the project’s needs and are on-site as needed.    Allocate Responsibilities and Tasks    Commercial flooring project managers coordinate with other trades and vendors when deciding how and when the flooring scope of a project is best implemented. Throughout the project build, they supervise the work and performance of the team, providing advice and guidance where they can, as well as ensuring that health and safety standards are met.    Prepare Reports    Commercial flooring project managers regularly assess the progress of the project and the performance of all involved. They prepare detailed reports for key stakeholders that outline the successes as well as any issues that arise throughout the development of the building.    Skills, Knowledge and Abilities necessary to do the job:    Commercial flooring project managers have an in-depth understanding of construction methods and principles, tools, and equipment. These team-players also have a familiarity of health and safety regulations. The following abilities are required:     Negotiation Skills  – Commercial flooring project managers are skilled at negotiating, whether it’s the price of materials, labor costs, and contract terms and conditions.    Time Management  – Commercial flooring projects hinge on tight deadlines and strict schedules, so commercial flooring project managers need to be organized to manage deadlines for themselves and workers on a project.    Leadership Skills  – This job requires the ability to assign tasks to installation workers, subcontractors, and other team members, so these managers need to have great leadership and delegation skills.    Problem-Solving Abilities  – Commercial flooring project managers handle unexpected issues and hold-ups and solve any challenges that arise over the course of a build, such as materials not arriving on time.    Communication Skills  – These professionals must communicate complex information and technical details to all parties involved. Including, but not limited to, Owners, Sub-contractors, Suppliers, Store Management, and Third-Party Contractors. Ensuring that all members of the team are aware of deadlines, schedule, and quality and safety requirements.        Place Services will offer the right candidate:     Family owned and operated company   Competitive base salary with Bonus potential   Per Diem pay when traveling   Medical, Vision & Dental Insurance, Life and Accident Insurance   401K Retirement Savings Plan including a ROTH IRA option   Generous Personal Time Off program & 7 paid Holidays   Growth opportunities throughout the organization        As an EEO employer,   Place Services, Inc.   is committed to providing all applicants and employees with equal access to employment opportunities, regardless of sex, race, age, color, national origin, disability, pregnancy, religion, genetic information, sexual orientation, transgender status, gender identity, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.   Place Services, Inc.   shall abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-300.5(a) and 60-741.5(a). These regulations prohibit discrimination against qualified individuals based on protected veteran status or disability and require affirmative action by covered prime contractors and subcontractors to employ and advance in employment qualified protected veterans and individuals with disabilities.     ]

title: Agile Project Manager
description: [    Job brief     GrainChain is seeking an Agile Project Manager (APM) responsible for planning, leading, organizing, and motivating Agile project teams. The APM’s goals are to achieve a high level of performance and quality and to deliver Agile projects that provide exceptional business value to users.    We are looking specifically for someone with experience as a Project Manager delivering software products or apps.      This APM will be responsible for managing several concurrent high visibility projects using Agile methods in a fast-paced environment that may cross multiple business divisions.     Duties and Responsibilities    Define project scope and schedule while focusing on regular and timely delivery of value; organize and lead project status and working meetings; prepare and distribute progress reports; manage risks and issues; correct deviations from plans; and perform delivery planning for assigned projects   Assist in team development while holding teams accountable for their commitments, removing roadblocks to their work; leveraging organizational resources to improve capacity for project work; and mentoring and developing team members   Support the Product Owner in managing customer expectations for project deliverables, managing stakeholder communications, and helping to implement an effective system of project governance   Promote empowerment of the team, ensure that each team member is fully engaged in the project and making a meaningful contribution, and encourage a sustainable pace with high levels of quality for the team       Requirements     3+ years of professional experience working with SCRUM/Agile methodologies on enterprise-level application development projects   8+ years of professional experience as a Project Manager managing large, complex software product or app projects in a high-tech development environment with multi-function teams   Expert knowledge of both Agile and traditional project management principles and practices and the ability to blend them together in the right proportions to fit a project and business environment   Solid understanding of the software development life cycle   Sufficient level of technical background to provide highly credible leadership to development teams   Evaluate complex project risks and issues accurately and objectively   Ability to provide leadership to business analysts and collaborate with customers   BA or BS or equivalent experience is required; MA or MS is a plus   Very effective interpersonal skills including mentoring, coaching, collaborating, and team building   Strong analytical, planning, and organizational skills with an ability to manage competing demands   Proven ability to lead software development projects and ensure objectives and goals are reached   Creative approach to problem solving with the ability to focus on details while maintaining the “big picture” view   Demonstrated experience of collaboration using Jira, Confluence, Google Suite and the Microsoft Office suite of products.   Strong verbal and written English required   Verbal and written Spanish desirable     ]

title: Senior Product Manager
description: [      At Cloudinary we are building the world’s best platform for end-to-end media management. As the leader in cloud-based image and video management for both web and mobile applications, Cloudinary is the natural choice for companies wanting to upload, store, manipulate, optimize and deliver images and video.   Cloudinary is looking for an experienced Product Manager with a strong technical background to join as a key member of the Product team and work on defining the next generations of Cloudinary's comprehensive media management solutions. This position involves broad responsibilities while leading product efforts in collaboration with various stakeholders within and outside the company.   This role is located in Santa Clara, CA office. About You:     5+ years of experience as a Product Manager responsible for a SaaS product   Bachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent.
